card-1.title: Understanding Social Triggers
card-1.description: Identify what specifically triggers your social anxiety and learn to observe these patterns without judgment.
card-1.welcomeMessage: This exercise will help you become more aware of your social anxiety triggers. By understanding what sets off your anxiety, you can begin to respond rather than react.

questions.text: What specific social situations make you feel most anxious or uncomfortable?
questions.placeholder: Example: Speaking up in group conversations, meeting new people...
questions.helpText: Think about recent situations where you felt socially anxious.

questions.text: What thoughts go through your mind in these situations?
questions.placeholder: Example: They will think I'm boring, I will say something stupid...
questions.helpText: Notice the automatic thoughts that increase your anxiety.

finalMessage.message: Awareness of your social anxiety patterns is the first step toward managing them effectively.
finalMessage.practiceTask: Over the next week, notice when you feel socially anxious and write down the specific trigger and your thoughts.
finalMessage.whyExplanation: Self-awareness helps you distinguish between real social threats and anxiety-driven perceptions.

card-2.title: Building Social Confidence
card-2.description: Develop practical strategies to feel more confident and authentic in social interactions.
card-2.welcomeMessage: Learn to build genuine confidence in social situations by focusing on connection rather than performance.

questions.text: When do you feel most naturally confident around others?
questions.placeholder: Example: With close friends, when helping someone, when discussing my interests...
questions.helpText: Identify situations where your authentic self shines through.

questions.text: What qualities do you appreciate in yourself that others might value too?
questions.placeholder: Example: Good listener, caring, funny, knowledgeable about...
questions.helpText: Focus on your genuine strengths and positive qualities.

finalMessage.message: Confidence grows when you focus on giving value to others rather than seeking approval.
finalMessage.practiceTask: In your next social interaction, focus on being genuinely interested in the other person rather than worrying about how you appear.
finalMessage.whyExplanation: Shifting focus from self-consciousness to genuine interest reduces anxiety and improves connections.
